item.title: Panel Data article
item.description: What is Panel Data # Panel Data has two dimensions: Longitudinal: observasions cross sections (locations, sites, etc) Short: observasions across time. Sometimes panel data are also refered as logitudinal data, pooled data, cross-sectional time-series data.

Sometimes panel data are also refered as logitudinal data, pooled data, cross-sectional time-series data. But for files not named as _index.md. item.title: How to Update 2
item.description: Problems updating npm packages # Delete the ./node_modules folder, and run again: npm install Problems with cache # Delete the temporary directories: npm run clean

item.title: How to add images
item.description: When writing docs under Doks theme the images were strictly organized under page bundle. â”œâ”€â”€ blog/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ say-hello-to-doks/ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ index.md â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ say-hello-to-doks.png â”‚ â””â”€â”€ _index.md â””â”€â”€ _index.md If you want to refer to images not following the above structure, you can refer to images in hyperlink [asf](/2022-05-19-18-31-12.png) \![images](/2022-05-19-18-31-12.png) \![images](/images/2022-05-19-18-31-14.png) and will get: asf !images !images Or you can place images using html code:
